oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Participatory breeding system for laying hens
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Leenstra, Ferry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
Poultry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Livestock breeds (and breeding systems) developed for intensive production systems often do not perform as expected in organic and extensive systems. For these alternative systems animals need good social and ranging behaviour, which is in general not necessary in intensive systems with greater confinement for the animals. Although this is the case in all the livestock species (e.g. dairy cows, pigs and sheep), in poultry, the differences between organic/free range and conventional systems are comparatively large
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Leenstra, Ferry (2010) Participatory breeding system for laying hens. LowInputBreeds Newsletter , April 2010 (2), p. 4.
